poem:
**The Selfie Conspiracy**

I learned from Sarah Jessica,  
how to dodge the fanfare—  
a simple excuse,  
that slyly skirts the lens.  
  
"The government," I'd whisper,  
is quite enough to freeze  
a prodding arm,  
indeed confirming what we fear—  
surveillance from every corner,  
and yet we smile—  
our own conspirators.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What SJP's selfie trick tells us about the terrifying rise of conspiracy theories | Arwa Mahdawi Sarah Jessica Parker, the Sex and the City star and Booker prize judge, has a nifty trick for getting out of taking selfies with her fans. “I did this for a really, really long time and it worked for ever,” Parker said in an interview with Howard Stern. “I used to say, ‘I can’t, because of the government,’ and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
